citation.name: Neuron
citation.title: Deficiency of asparagine synthetase causes congenital microcephaly and a progressive form of encephalopathy.

reference.scope: VARIANTS ASNSD GLU-6; VAL-362 AND CYS-550
CHARACTERIZATION OF VARIANTS ASNSD GLU-6; VAL-362 AND CYS-550

comment.text: ATP + L-aspartate + L-glutamine + H(2)O = AMP + diphosphate + L-asparagine + L-glutamate.
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-asparagine biosynthesis; L-asparagine from L-aspartate (L-Gln route): step 1/1.

disease.name: Asparagine synthetase deficiency
disease.description: An inborn error of asparagine biosynthesis that results in a severe neurologic disorder characterized by microcephaly, severely delayed psychomotor development, progressive encephalopathy, cortical atrophy, and seizure or hyperekplexic activity.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

property.value: Congenital microcephaly-severe encephalopathy-progressive cerebral atrophy syndrome
P:positive regulation of mitotic cell cycle

feature.description: ATP; via amide nitrogen and carbonyl oxygen
In ASNSD; dramatic reduction in protein abundance; dbSNP:rs398122975.
In ASNSD; dramatic reduction in protein abundance; dbSNP:rs398122973.
In ASNSD; increases level of protein abundance; dbSNP:rs398122974.
Loss of the glutamine-dependent asparagine synthetase activity, while the ammonia-dependent activity remained unaffected.
